cards.name: Waning Wurm
cards.text: Vanishing 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
cards.originalText: Vanishing 2 (This permanent comes into play with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Bog Serpent
cards.text:
Bog Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls a Swamp.
When you control no Swamps, sacrifice Bog Serpent.
cards.flavor:
"We thought it was a fallen tree trunk. Then it ate Snod."
—Sneed, goblin barkwright

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Sea Serpent.

cards.originalText:
Bog Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls a Swamp.
When you control no Swamps, sacrifice Bog Serpent.

cards.name: Damnation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Wrath of God.

cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Dunerider Outlaw
cards.text:
Protection from green
At the beginning of each end step, if Dunerider Outlaw dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Tales of the outlaw's cruelty and might grew more embellished with each crime.

rulings.text: If it damages the opponent multiple times in a turn, it gets only one +1/+1 counter at end of turn.
Dunerider Outlaw gets a maximum of one +1/+1 counter at end of turn, no matter how many times it may have dealt damage to an opponent.

Dunerider Outlaw's triggered ability checks to see if it dealt damage during the turn to an opponent of its current controller. If it dealt damage to player A, then player A takes control of it, the ability doesn't trigger.

If Dunerider Outlaw dealt damage to an opponent of its current controller during the turn and that opponent is no longer in the game at end of turn, the ability will still trigger and the Outlaw will still get a +1/+1 counter.
This is the timeshifted version of Whirling Dervish.

cards.originalText:
Protection from green
At end of turn, if Dunerider Outlaw dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Kor Dirge
cards.text: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.
cards.flavor: Rath's new evincar eliminated the brutish moggs and took a new slave race, one more reminiscent of her own feline grace.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Kor Chant.

cards.originalText: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.

cards.name: Melancholy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Melancholy enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Melancholy unless you pay {B}.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Thirst.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Melancholy comes into play, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Melancholy unless you pay {B}.

cards.name: Null Profusion
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you play a card, draw a card.
Your maximum hand size is two.
cards.flavor:
"Some say that time is cyclical and that history inevitably repeats. My will is my own. I won't bow to fate."
—Volrath

rulings.text: The triggered ability will trigger when you play a land card or cast a nonland card as a spell. It won't trigger when you play a copy of a card, such as with Isochron Scepter.
Your maximum hand size is checked only during the cleanup step of your turn. At any other time, you may have any number of cards in hand.
This is the timeshifted version of Recycle.
Countering a spell that has been cast will not prevent you from drawing the card.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Spellbook (an artifact that says you have no maximum hand size) onto the battlefield and then put Null Profusion onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size will be two. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, you would have no maximum hand size.

cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you play a card, draw a card.
Your maximum hand size is two.

cards.name: Rathi Trapper
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: Tangling vines, fetid murk, paralyzing poisons, and crawling dead. The swamp is nature's trap waiting to be exploited by unnatural minds.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Master Decoy.

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Shrouded Lore
cards.text: Target opponent chooses a card in your graveyard. You may pay {B}. If you do, repeat this process except that opponent can't choose a card already chosen for Shrouded Lore. Then put the last chosen card into your hand.

rulings.text: You target an opponent when you cast Shrouded Lore. The opponent chooses a card in your graveyard as Shrouded Lore resolves. After that choice is made, you're given the option to pay {B}. If you do, the targeted opponent must choose a different card, if there is one. (If there isn't one, this part is skipped.) Then you're given the option to pay {B} again. As long as you keep paying {B}, the process continues. As soon as you decline to pay {B}, the last card that was chosen by the opponent is put into your hand.
The spell has no knowledge of cards chosen for other spells named Shrouded Lore.
This is the timeshifted version of Forgotten Lore.

cards.originalText: Target opponent chooses a card in your graveyard. You may pay {B}. If you do, repeat this process except that opponent can't choose a card already chosen for Shrouded Lore. Then put the last chosen card into your hand.

cards.name: Vampiric Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: The familiar's fangs deliver the master's bite.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Spirit Link.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Aether Membrane
cards.text:
Defender; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Aether Membrane blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat.

rulings.text: The blocked creature is returned to its owner's hand at end of combat only if the blocked creature is still on the battlefield. It doesn't matter whether Aether Membrane is on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Defender
Æther Membrane can block as though it had flying.
Whenever Æther Membrane blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat.

cards.name: Akroma, Angel of Fury
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Flying, trample, protection from white and from blue
{R}: Akroma, Angel of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: If Akroma, Angel of Fury is cast face down, it can be countered.
Akroma, Angel of Fury and Akroma, Angel of Wrath do not have the same name, so the legend rule does not apply.

In a Commander game where this card is your commander, you may cast it face-down from the Command zone by paying {3} plus {2} for each time it has been cast from your command zone. The cost to turn it face-up is unaffected.
The "legend rule" cares about legendary permanents with the exact same English name. You can control Akroma, Angel of Fury and Akroma, Angel of Wrath at the same time.

foreignNames.name: 憤怒の天使アクローマ

cards.originalText:
Akroma, Angel of Fury can't be countered.
Flying, trample, protection from white, protection from blue
{R}: Akroma, Angel of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {3}{R}{R}{R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Battering Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have trample.
cards.flavor: Covered with hard shell-like plates, these slivers burrow through solid rock to carve out new nests for their hives.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have trample.

cards.name: Detritivore
cards.text:
Detritivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of nonbasic land cards in your opponents' graveyards.
Suspend X—{X}{3}{R}. X can't be 0. (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {X}{3}{R} and exile it with X time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever a time counter is removed from Detritivore while it's exiled, destroy target nonbasic land.

rulings.text: The triggered ability is mandatory. If no other player has any nonbasic lands on the battlefield, you must target one of your own.
Both instances of X in the suspend ability are the same. You determine the value of X as you suspend the card from your hand. The value you choose must be at least 1.

If this is suspended, then when the last time counter is removed from it, both its triggered ability and the "play this card" part of the suspend ability will trigger. They can be put on the stack in either order.

You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. Whether or not you could actually complete all steps in casting the card is irrelevant. For example, you can exile a card with suspend that has no mana cost or requires a target even if no legal targets are available at that time.
Exiling a card with suspend isn't casting that card. This action doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
If the spell requires any targets, those targets are chosen when the spell is finally cast, not when it's exiled.
If the first triggered ability of suspend (the one that removes time counters) is countered, no time counter is removed. The ability will trigger again during the card's owner's next upkeep.
When the last time counter is removed, the second triggered ability of suspend will trigger. It doesn't matter why the last time counter was removed or what effect removed it.
If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.
As the second triggered ability resolves, you must cast the card if able. Timing restrictions based on the card's type are ignored.
If you can't cast the card, perhaps because there are no legal targets available, it remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If the spell has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those if able. However, if an additional cost includes a mana payment, you are forced to pay that cost only if there's enough mana in your mana pool at the time you cast the spell. You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.
A creature cast using suspend will enter the battlefield with haste. It will have haste until another player gains control of it (or, in some rare cases, gains control of the creature spell itself).

cards.originalText:
Detritivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of nonbasic land cards in your opponents' graveyards.
Suspend X—{X}{3}{R}. X can't be 0.
Whenever a time counter is removed from Detritivore while it's removed from the game, destroy target nonbasic land.

cards.name: Dust Corona
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"They infiltrated deep into the enemy camp under cover of darkness . . . and dirt."
—Corus, viashino warrior

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don't actually have Flying.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and can't be blocked by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Fatal Frenzy
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains trample and gets +X/+0, where X is its power. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"I hope to have such a death—lying in triumph upon the broken bodies of those who slew me."
—Radha, Keldon warlord

rulings.text: If you don't control the affected creature at end of turn, it isn't sacrificed.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains trample and gets +X/+0, where X is its power. Sacrifice it at end of turn.

cards.name: Firefright Mage
cards.text: {1}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't be blocked this turn except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.
cards.flavor: After millennia of advancement in goblin military theory, Toggo VI realized that almost everyone is afraid of fire.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't be blocked this turn except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.

cards.name: Fury Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Remove two time counters from target permanent or suspended card.
cards.originalText: Choose one Destroy target artifact; or target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn; or remove two time counters from target permanent or suspended card.

cards.name: Hammerheim Deadeye
cards.text:
Echo {5}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Hammerheim Deadeye enters the battlefield, destroy target creature with flying.

foreignNames.name: ハンマーハイムの落とし屋

cards.originalText:
Echo {5}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Hammerheim Deadeye comes into play, destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Keldon Marauders
cards.text:
Vanishing 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Keldon Marauders enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.originalText:
Vanishing 2 (This permanent comes into play with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Keldon Marauders comes into play or leaves play, it deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lavacore Elemental
cards.text:
Vanishing 1 (This creature enters the battlefield with a time counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put a time counter on Lavacore Elemental.

rulings.text: If multiple creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, Lavacore Elemental's ability triggers that many times.
If Lavacore Elemental deals combat damage to a player, it triggers its own ability.

cards.originalText:
Vanishing 1 (This permanent comes into play with a time counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put a time counter on Lavacore Elemental.

cards.name: Magus of the Arena
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature you control and target creature of an opponent's choice they control. Those creatures fight each other. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: The magus still hears the roar of the crowds. They're gone, but the will to compete remains.

rulings.text: If either target leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability taps the remaining target, but no damage is dealt. If both targets leave the battlefield, the ability doesn't resolve.
Magus of the Arena's controller always chooses their creature first.
Tapped creatures can be targeted. Tapping them again will do nothing, but they'll still deal damage.
If an effect changes the targets of this ability, the second target can be changed to any creature the chosen opponent controls. The choice of opponent can't be changed.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature you control and target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to the other.

cards.name: Needlepeak Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"It's a testament to the forests' devastation that giant spiders now make their homes amid Dominaria's barren spires."
—Aznaph, greenseeker
cards.originalText: Needlepeak Spider can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Shivan Meteor
cards.text:
Shivan Meteor deals 13 damage to target creature.
Suspend 2—{1}{R}{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{R}{R} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

rulings.text: You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. Whether or not you could actually complete all steps in casting the card is irrelevant. For example, you can exile a card with suspend that has no mana cost or requires a target even if no legal targets are available at that time.
Exiling a card with suspend isn't casting that card. This action doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
If the spell requires any targets, those targets are chosen when the spell is finally cast, not when it's exiled.
If the first triggered ability of suspend (the one that removes time counters) is countered, no time counter is removed. The ability will trigger again during the card's owner's next upkeep.
When the last time counter is removed, the second triggered ability of suspend will trigger. It doesn't matter why the last time counter was removed or what effect removed it.
If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.
As the second triggered ability resolves, you must cast the card if able. Timing restrictions based on the card's type are ignored.
If you can't cast the card, perhaps because there are no legal targets available, it remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If the spell has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those if able. However, if an additional cost includes a mana payment, you are forced to pay that cost only if there's enough mana in your mana pool at the time you cast the spell. You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.
A creature cast using suspend will enter the battlefield with haste. It will have haste until another player gains control of it (or, in some rare cases, gains control of the creature spell itself).

cards.originalText:
Shivan Meteor deals 13 damage to target creature.
Suspend 2—{1}{R}{R} (Rather than play this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{R}{R} and remove it from the game with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, play it without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Stingscourger
cards.text:
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Stingscourger enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Stingscourger comes into play, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sulfur Elemental
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
White creatures get +1/-1.

rulings.text: Players still get priority while a card with split second is on the stack.
Split second doesn't prevent players from activating mana abilities.
Split second doesn't prevent triggered abilities from triggering. If one does, its controller puts it on the stack and chooses targets for it, if any. Those abilities will resolve as normal.
Split second doesn't prevent players from performing special actions. Notably, players may turn face-down creatures face up while a spell with split second is on the stack.
Casting a spell with split second won't affect spells and abilities that are already on the stack.
If the resolution of a triggered ability involves casting a spell, that spell can't be cast if a spell with split second is on the stack.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may play this spell any time you could play an instant.)
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't play spells or activated abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
White creatures get +1/-1.

cards.name: Timecrafting
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Remove X time counters from target permanent or suspended card.
• Put X time counters on target permanent with a time counter on it or suspended card.
cards.flavor: Oddly, an unstable time stream makes wizards want to tinker with it even more.
cards.originalText: Choose one Remove X time counters from target permanent or suspended card; or put X time counters on target permanent with a time counter on it or suspended card.

cards.name: Torchling
cards.text:
{R}: Untap Torchling.
{R}: Target creature blocks Torchling this turn if able.
{R}: Change the target of target spell that targets only Torchling.
{1}: Torchling gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}: Torchling gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: When the third ability resolves, you must change the target if able. If you can't choose a legal target for the spell when this ability resolves, that spell's target doesn't change.
If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Torchling's third ability, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.

If a spell has multiple targets, but it's targeting Torchling with all of them (such as Seeds of Strength targeting Torchling three times), you can target that spell with Torchling's third ability. In that case, you change all of those targets to the same new target, as long as it meets each of the spell's targeting conditions.

cards.originalText:
{R}: Untap Torchling.
{R}: Target creature blocks Torchling this turn if able.
{R}: Change the target of target spell that targets only Torchling.
{1}: Torchling gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}: Torchling gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Volcano Hellion
cards.text:
Volcano Hellion has echo {X}, where X is your life total. (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Volcano Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals an amount of damage of your choice to you and target creature. The damage can't be prevented.

rulings.text: As Volcano Hellion's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, you choose a number. Volcano Hellion deals that amount of damage to you and to the targeted creature. You may choose 0.
Volcano Hellion's echo cost constantly changes; it's not locked in when it enters the battlefield. The echo cost you pay is equal your life total as the echo triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Volcano Hellion has echo {X}, where X is your life total.
When Volcano Hellion comes into play, it deals an amount of damage of your choice to you and target creature. The damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Boom
cards.text: Destroy target land you control and target land you don't control.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land you control and target land you don't control.

cards.name: Bust
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Dead
cards.text: Dead deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.originalText: Dead deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Gone
cards.text: Return target creature you don't control to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target creature you don't control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Rough
cards.text: Rough deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.originalText: Rough deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Tumble
cards.text: Tumble deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.originalText: Tumble deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Blood Knight
cards.text: First strike, protection from white
cards.flavor: His is the fury of the wildfire, the boiling blood of the volcano. He fights you not because you've wronged him, but because you're there.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Black Knight.

cards.originalText: First strike, protection from white

cards.name: Brute Force
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Blood, bone, and sinew are magnified, as is the rage that drives them. The brain, however, remains unchanged—a little bean, swinging by a strand in a cavernous, raving head.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Giant Growth.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Molten Firebird
cards.text:
Flying
When Molten Firebird dies, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step and you skip your next draw step.
{4}{R}: Exile Molten Firebird.

rulings.text: The player who controlled Molten Firebird when it was put into a graveyard will skip their next draw step even if Molten Firebird is returned to the battlefield under a different player's control (because it's owned by someone else) or isn't returned to the battlefield at all (because it left the graveyard before the end of the turn, for example).
The second ability can be activated only if Molten Firebird is on the battlefield.
This is the timeshifted version of Ivory Gargoyle.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Molten Firebird is put into a graveyard from play, return it to play under its owner's control at end of turn and you skip your next draw step.
{4}{R}: Remove Molten Firebird from the game.

cards.name: Prodigal Pyromancer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Learn to burn!"
—Institute of Arcane Studies motto

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Prodigal Sorcerer.

cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Pyrohemia
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pyrohemia.
{R}: Pyrohemia deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
This is the timeshifted version of Pestilence.
Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

cards.originalText:
At end of turn, if no creatures are in play, sacrifice Pyrohemia.
{R}: Pyrohemia deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Reckless Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
Madness {2}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: Bred for battle in the Grand Coliseum, these wurms annihilated whole ecosystems when released into the wild.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Arrogant Wurm.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Madness {2}{R} (If you discard this card, you may play it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Shivan Wumpus
cards.text:
Trample
When Shivan Wumpus enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice a land. If a player does, put Shivan Wumpus on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: It's easier to move the village than to divert the wumpus.

rulings.text: When Shivan Wumpus enters the battlefield, first the active player gets the option to sacrifice a land. If they decline, the next player in turn order gets the option. If a player elects to sacrifice a land, Shivan Wumpus is put on top of its owner's library, but then all remaining players still get the option. If all players decline, then nothing happens and Shivan Wumpus stays on the battlefield.
This is the timeshifted version of Argothian Wurm.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When Shivan Wumpus comes into play, any player may sacrifice a land. If a player does, put Shivan Wumpus on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Simian Spirit Guide
cards.text: Exile Simian Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {R}.
cards.flavor:
"All my spells smell like burnt hair lately."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Elvish Spirit Guide.
This ability is a mana ability.

cards.originalText: Remove Simian Spirit Guide in your hand from the game: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Skirk Shaman
cards.text: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.
cards.flavor: In a shaman's grimy hands, a concoction of dried Skirk Ridge herbs can become the face of panic.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Severed Legion.

foreignNames.name: スカークのシャーマン

cards.originalText: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.

cards.name: Ana Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{U} and/or {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} and/or {1}{B} as you cast this spell.)
When Ana Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, target player discards three cards.
When Ana Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, tap target untapped creature and that creature deals damage equal to its power to its controller.

rulings.text: The second triggered ability targets an untapped creature. If there are no other untapped creatures when Ana Battlemage enters the battlefield, it must target Ana Battlemage. If the target becomes tapped by the time the ability tries to resolve, the ability won't resolve.

cards.name: Citanul Woodreaders
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Citanul Woodreaders enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, draw two cards.
cards.flavor: They seek out living trees to glean age-old secrets from sap and wood.

foreignNames.name: シタヌールの樹木読み

cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you play this spell.)
When Citanul Woodreaders comes into play, if the kicker cost was paid, draw two cards.

cards.name: Deadwood Treefolk
cards.text:
Vanishing 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Deadwood Treefolk enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, return another target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

foreignNames.name: デッドウッドのツリーフォーク

cards.originalText:
Vanishing 3 (This permanent comes into play with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Deadwood Treefolk comes into play or leaves play, return another target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Evolution Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library; or return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand; or target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Fungal Behemoth
cards.text:
Fungal Behemoth's power and toughness are each equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on creatures you control.
Suspend X—{X}{G}{G}. X can't be 0. (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {X}{G}{G} and exile it with X time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever a time counter is removed from Fungal Behemoth while it's exiled, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: Any +1/+1 counters on Fungal Behemoth itself count toward its base power and toughness, then give it a power and toughness bonus. For example, if there are two +1/+1 counters on Fungal Behemoth and three on other creatures you control, Fungal Behemoth is a 7/7 creature.
Both instances of X in the suspend ability are the same. You determine the value of X as you suspend the card from your hand. The value you choose must be at least 1.

If this is suspended, then when the last time counter is removed from it, both its triggered ability and the "play this card" part of the suspend ability will trigger. They can be put on the stack in either order.

You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. Whether or not you could actually complete all steps in casting the card is irrelevant. For example, you can exile a card with suspend that has no mana cost or requires a target even if no legal targets are available at that time.
Exiling a card with suspend isn't casting that card. This action doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
If the spell requires any targets, those targets are chosen when the spell is finally cast, not when it's exiled.
If the first triggered ability of suspend (the one that removes time counters) is countered, no time counter is removed. The ability will trigger again during the card's owner's next upkeep.
When the last time counter is removed, the second triggered ability of suspend will trigger. It doesn't matter why the last time counter was removed or what effect removed it.
If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.
As the second triggered ability resolves, you must cast the card if able. Timing restrictions based on the card's type are ignored.
If you can't cast the card, perhaps because there are no legal targets available, it remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If the spell has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those if able. However, if an additional cost includes a mana payment, you are forced to pay that cost only if there's enough mana in your mana pool at the time you cast the spell. You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.
A creature cast using suspend will enter the battlefield with haste. It will have haste until another player gains control of it (or, in some rare cases, gains control of the creature spell itself).

cards.originalText:
Fungal Behemoth's power and toughness are each equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on creatures you control.
Suspend X—{X}{G}{G}. X can't be 0.
Whenever a time counter is removed from Fungal Behemoth while it's removed from the game, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Giant Dustwasp
cards.text:
Flying
Suspend 4—{1}{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{G} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

rulings.text: You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. Whether or not you could actually complete all steps in casting the card is irrelevant. If the first triggered ability of suspend (the one that removes time counters) is countered, no time counter is removed. The ability will trigger again during the card's owner's next upkeep.
When the last time counter is removed, the second triggered ability of suspend will trigger. It doesn't matter why the last time counter was removed or what effect removed it.
If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If you can't cast the card, perhaps because there are no legal targets available, it remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If the spell has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those if able. However, if an additional cost includes a mana payment, you are forced to pay that cost only if there's enough mana in your mana pool at the time you cast the spell. You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.
A creature cast using suspend will enter the battlefield with haste. It will have haste until another player gains control of it (or, in some rare cases, gains control of the creature spell itself).

cards.originalText:
Flying
Suspend 4—{1}{G} (Rather than play this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{G} and remove it from the game with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, play it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

cards.name: Hunting Wilds
cards.text:
Kicker {3}{G} (You may pay an additional {3}{G} as you cast this spell.)
Search your library for up to two Forest cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
If this spell was kicked, untap all Forests put onto the battlefield this way. They become 3/3 green creatures with haste that are still lands.

rulings.text: If the Hunting Wilds is kicked, the Forests become creatures with haste permanently.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {3}{G} (You may pay an additional {3}{G} as you play this spell.)
Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.
If the kicker cost was paid, untap all Forests put into play this way. They become 3/3 green creatures with haste that are still lands.

cards.name: Jedit Ojanen of Efrava
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
Whenever Jedit Ojanen of Efrava attacks or blocks, create a 2/2 green Cat Warrior creature token with forestwalk.
cards.flavor: The cat warriors recognized this Jedit's face, but not his fierce loyalty to Efrava.

rulings.text: If Jedit Ojanen of Efrava attacks or blocks and a token is created, it will be too late for that token to be declared as an attacker (if it somehow gets haste) or a blocker during that combat phase.

foreignNames.name: エフラヴァのジェディット・オジャネン

cards.originalText:
Forestwalk
Whenever Jedit Ojanen of Efrava attacks or blocks, put a 2/2 green Cat Warrior creature token with forestwalk into play.

cards.name: Kavu Predator
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.
cards.flavor: In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.

rulings.text: Kavu Predator's last ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Kor Firewalker or 6 life from Renewed Faith.

Each creature with lifelink dealing combat damage is a single life-gaining event. For example, if two creatures an opponent controls with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, Kavu Predator's ability will trigger twice. However, if a single creature an opponent controls with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will trigger only once.
If an opponent gains an amount of life "for each" of something (such as from Congregate), that life is gained as one event and Kavu Predator's ability triggers only once.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.

cards.name: Life and Limb
cards.text: All Forests and all Saprolings are 1/1 green Saproling creatures and Forest lands in addition to their other types.
cards.flavor:
"It was a sight of pain and awe—a twisted forest, migrating across the salt plain in search of richer soil."
—Edahlis, greenseeker

rulings.text: Each Forest and Saproling will have the card types creature and land, and the subtypes Forest and Saproling. Each subtype maintains its correlation to the proper type: Forest is not a creature type and Saproling is not a land type.
When Life and Limb leaves the battlefield, the effect ends and the permanents go back to what they were (unless another effect grants these card types and/or subtypes to the affected permanents).
Forests that enter the battlefield while Life and Limb is on the battlefield will enter the battlefield as creatures. They'll have summoning sickness.
Saprolings that are on the battlefield while Life and Limb is on the battlefield have the ability "{T}: Add {G}." Although they're Forests, they are not basic lands.
With Life and Limb on the battlefield, Mistform Ultimus will be a legendary 1/1 green land creature that has land type Forest and has all creature types.

foreignNames.name: Survivre à la force des bras

cards.originalText: All Forests and all Saprolings are 1/1 green Saproling creatures and Forest lands in addition to their other types.

cards.name: Magus of the Library
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have exactly seven cards in hand.
cards.flavor: The ancient books slowly crumbled, their secrets turning to dust. But their every word sings within the magus's head.

rulings.text: You may tap multiples of these in response to each other because the requirement for 7 cards is checked only at the time the ability is announced and not again when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Draw a card. Play this ability only if you have exactly seven cards in hand.

cards.name: Mire Boa
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
{G}: Regenerate Mire Boa.
cards.flavor: Mire slime courses through its veins in place of blood. No sooner does it bleed than it opens its mouth to replace the loss.
cards.originalText:
Swampwalk
{G}: Regenerate Mire Boa.

cards.text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
If Pouncing Wurm was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it and with haste.

rulings.text: If the Pouncing Wurm is kicked, Pouncing Wurm has haste permanently.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you play this spell.)

cards.name: Reflex Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have haste.
cards.flavor:
"This sliver comes into the world a perfect predator. It's ready to hunt and devour its first meal within seconds of hatching."
—Rukarumel, field journal

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have haste.

cards.name: Sophic Centaur
cards.text: {2}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: He endures the pain of remembering Krosa as it once was and hopes that a future generation will have need of his memories.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Timbermare
cards.text:
Haste
Echo {5}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Timbermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
cards.flavor: Only nature wreaks such lovely havoc.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Echo {5}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

cards.name: Utopia Vow
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: "I'll guard this fruit and its seedling until the land is healed. My life now belongs to Dominaria."
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Vitaspore Thallid
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Vitaspore Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Vitaspore Thallid: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Vitaspore Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Vitaspore Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Wild Pair
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, you may search your library for a creature card with the same total power and toughness and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If you cast a 2/2 Grizzly Bears, for example, you may then search for any creature with total power and toughness 4. It can be 0/4, 1/3, 2/2, or 3/1.

The game checks the power and toughness of the creature that just entered the battlefield as it exists on the battlefield. That might mean it's impossible to get another copy of that same card. For example, a Triskelion on the battlefield is 4/4, but a Triskelion in your library is 1/1. The power and toughness might also have been affected while the triggered ability was on the stack (such as with Giant Growth, Sudden Death, or Ovinize).

If the creature that entered the battlefield has left the battlefield by the time the ability resolves, use the power and toughness of that creature as it last appeared before leaving the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, if you played it from your hand, you may search your library for a creature card with the same total power and toughness and put it into play. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Essence Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"The more our numbers grow, the more I gain hope that Volrath and his cursed stronghold will one day fall."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
This is the timeshifted version of Soul Warden.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Fa'adiyah Seer
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.
cards.flavor: "My visions don't show me home. They show me where home is yet to be found."

rulings.text: If the draw is replaced by another effect, none of the rest of Fa'adiyah Seer's ability applies, even if the draw is replaced by another draw (such as with Enduring Renewal).
To avoid confusion, reveal the card you draw before putting it with the rest of the cards in your hand.
This is the timeshifted version of Sindbad.

foreignNames.name: ファーディヤーの予見者

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

cards.name: Gaea's Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor:
"To those who can hear it, Gaea's battle song brings power as swift as sunlight and as enduring as the deep roots of the forest."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Glorious Anthem.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Groundbreaker
cards.text:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Groundbreaker.
cards.flavor: The earth's memory is long, its retribution brief.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Ball Lightning.
The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
At end of turn, sacrifice Groundbreaker.

cards.name: Harmonize
cards.text: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor:
"Life's greatest lessons don't come from focus or concentration. They come from breathing and simply noticing."
—Seton, centaur druid

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Concentrate.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards.

cards.name: Healing Leaves
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: The elves of Llanowar don't trust in alchemy. They rely instead on pure herbs harvested from the forest's sacred heart.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Healing Salve.

cards.originalText: Choose one Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Hedge Troll
cards.text:
Hedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Plains.
{W}: Regenerate Hedge Troll.
cards.flavor: His abode was clean and bare, not a morsel in sight. I asked him what he ate, fearing the answer. He smiled and said his faith alone sustained him.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Sedge Troll.

cards.originalText:
Hedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Plains.
{W}: Regenerate Hedge Troll.

cards.name: Keen Sense
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Crovax sensed that Mirri wasn't ready for the curse taking hold of her. Weeping in his heart, he fled.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Curiosity.
You draw one card each time the enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, no matter how much damage it deals or whether it was dealt in combat.
If this Aura enchants an opponent's creature, you won't draw a card when that creature damages you. The creature has to deal damage to one of your opponents for the ability to trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Seal of Primordium
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Primordium: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"I am the simplifier, the root that drags all artifice to earth."
—Seal inscription

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.
This is the timeshifted version of Seal of Cleansing.

You can activate Seal of Primordium's ability targeting Seal of Primordium itself if you want it to leave the battlefield. This is because targets are chosen before costs are paid. The ability won't resolve as it tries to resolve.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Primordium: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Cautery Sliver
cards.text:
All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 1 damage to any target."
All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this permanent: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target player, planeswalker, or Sliver creature this turn."

rulings.text: Note that the first ability can affect any kind of creature, but the second ability can affect only Slivers. Both abilities can affect players.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText:
All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this creature: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this creature: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target Sliver or player this turn."

cards.name: Darkheart Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 3 life."
cards.flavor:
"At first we thought we were in some haunted wood. Then the branches twisted and scuttled toward us."
—Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

rulings.text: The player who controlled the Sliver that's sacrificed gains the life, not the controller of Darkheart Sliver.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "Sacrifice this creature: You gain 3 life."

cards.name: Dormant Sliver
cards.text:
All Sliver creatures have defender.
All Slivers have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, draw a card."
cards.flavor:
"It triggers the hive's period of Ætheric fertility—a time when even feeding is a lower priority than reproduction."
—Rukarumel, field journal

rulings.text: The controller of the Sliver that enters the battlefield, not the controller of Dormant Sliver, draws a card.
The ability triggers when Dormant Sliver enters the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have defender and "When this creature comes into play, draw a card."

cards.name: Frenetic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{0}: If this permanent is on the battlefield, flip a coin. If you win the flip, exile this permanent and return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step. If you lose the flip, sacrifice it."

rulings.text: For any given Sliver, this ability can be activated numerous times in response to itself, but the end result is that only one coin will be flipped for that Sliver.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "{0}: If this creature is in play, flip a coin. If you win the flip, remove this creature from the game and return it to play under its owner's control at end of turn. If you lose the flip, sacrifice it."

cards.name: Intet, the Dreamer
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Intet, the Dreamer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, exile the top card of your library face down. You may look at that card for as long as it remains exiled. You may play that card without paying its mana cost for as long as Intet remains on the battlefield.

rulings.text: After Intet leaves the battlefield, if a card exiled this way is still exiled, you may still look at it. You won't be able to play it, though.
Once you play a card this way, it leaves the Exile zone and goes to the stack. You won't be able to play it again.

foreignNames.name: 夢見るものインテット

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Intet, the Dreamer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, remove the top card of your library from the game face down. You may look at that card as long as it remains removed from the game. You may play that card without paying its mana cost as long as Intet remains in play.

cards.name: Necrotic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{3}, Sacrifice this permanent: Destroy target permanent."
cards.flavor: Though Volrath is long dead, the slivers have become everything he wanted them to be: mindless instruments of destruction and despair.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "{3}, Sacrifice this creature: Destroy target permanent."

cards.name: Numot, the Devastator
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Numot, the Devastator deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, destroy up to two target lands.

rulings.text: You choose the targets when the ability is put on the stack, and you choose whether to pay when it resolves. You may choose zero targets. You can pay the mana even if you chose zero targets.

foreignNames.name: 壊滅させるものヌーマット

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Numot, the Devastator deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, destroy up to two target lands.

cards.name: Oros, the Avenger
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Oros, the Avenger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, Oros deals 3 damage to each nonwhite creature.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Oros, the Avenger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, Oros deals 3 damage to each nonwhite creature.

cards.name: Radha, Heir to Keld
cards.text:
Whenever Radha, Heir to Keld attacks, you may add {R}{R}.
{T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: "Run home, cur. I've already taken your master's head. Don't make me thrash you with it."

rulings.text: Radha's triggered ability is not a mana ability (because it doesn't trigger from another mana ability). It goes on the stack and it can be countered.

foreignNames.name: ケルドの後継者、ラーダ

cards.originalText:
Whenever Radha, Heir to Keld attacks, you may add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Teneb, the Harvester
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Teneb, the Harvester deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: You choose the target when the ability is put on the stack, and you choose whether to pay when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Teneb, the Harvester deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, put target creature card in a graveyard into play under your control.

cards.name: Vorosh, the Hunter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Vorosh, the Hunter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, put six +1/+1 counters on Vorosh.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Vorosh, the Hunter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, put six +1/+1 counters on Vorosh.

cards.name: Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth
cards.text: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
cards.flavor:
"Yawgmoth's corpse is a wound in the universe. His foul blood seeps out, infecting the land with his final curse."
—Lord Windgrace

rulings.text: If Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and either Blood Moon or Magus of the Moon are on the battlefield, all nonbasic lands will be Mountains, not Swamps. Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth will be a Mountain as well. It will have "{T}: Add {R}" and no other abilities.
Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth isn't a Swamp while it's not on the battlefield.

Urborg's ability causes each land on the battlefield to have the land type Swamp. Each land thus has the ability "{T}: Add {B}." Nothing else changes about those lands, including their names, other subtypes, other abilities, and whether they're legendary or basic.

If Urborg loses its abilities (for example, if it becomes a creature and then Turn to Frog targets it), all lands on the battlefield, including Urborg, will still be Swamps, but Urborg won't have the ability "Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types." Urborg also won't be able to tap to produce {B}, but other lands (including those that enter the battlefield later in the turn) will. The way continuous effects work, Urborg's type-changing ability is applied before the effect that removes both the type-changing ability and its own mana ability.

foreignNames.name: ヨーグモスの墳墓、アーボーグ
约格莫夫之墓乌尔博格

cards.originalText: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.

cards.name: Abolish
cards.text:
You may discard a Plains card rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: As war raged on, the young mages became more direct in their tactics, often at great cost.
cards.originalText:
You may discard a plains from your hand instead of paying Abolish's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Aura Fracture
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: Jamuraa's rhystic mages treat magic as their garden, uprooting unwanted spells as bothersome weeds.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Avatar of Hope
cards.text:
If you have 3 or less life, this spell costs {6} less to cast.
Flying
Avatar of Hope can block any number of creatures.

rulings.text: The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {W}{W} to cast it.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If you have 3 life or less, Avatar of Hope costs {6} less to play.
Avatar of Hope may block any number of creatures.

cards.name: Blessed Wind
cards.text: Target player's life total becomes 20.
cards.flavor:
"The fourth wind of ascension is Anointer, deifying the worthy."
—Keld Triumphant

rulings.text: This counts as gaining or losing life as appropriate.

cards.originalText: Target player's life total becomes 20.

cards.name: Celestial Convergence
cards.text:
Celestial Convergence enters the battlefield with seven omen counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an omen counter from Celestial Convergence. If there are no omen counters on Celestial Convergence, the player with the highest life total wins the game. If two or more players are tied for highest life total, the game is a draw.
cards.originalText:
Celestial Convergence comes into play with seven omen counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an omen counter from Celestial Convergence. If there are no omen counters on Celestial Convergence, the player with the highest life total wins the game. If two or more players are tied for highest life total, the game is a draw.

cards.name: Diving Griffin
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor:
To outrace the griffin
—Kipamu expression meaning
"to do the impossible"
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Diving Griffin to tap.

cards.name: Entangler
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can block any number of creatures.
cards.flavor: "Tell me again," said Latulla, raising her fist, "how just one woman held back an entire Keldon platoon."
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature may block any number of creatures.

cards.name: Excise
cards.text: Exile target attacking creature unless its controller pays {X}.
cards.flavor:
"Creation is no great feat. Anything you make, I can unmake in a heartbeat."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

rulings.text: The creature's controller gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

cards.originalText: Remove target attacking creature from the game unless its controller pays {X}.

cards.name: Flowering Field
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn."
cards.flavor: Some lands are soothing, and their peace can be felt in the soul.

rulings.text: The land's controller gets to activate the ability.

cards.originalText: Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."

Flying

cards.flavor: As he knows all the world completely, the world refuses him harm.

cards.name: Mageta the Lion
cards.text: {2}{W}{W}, {T}, Discard two cards: Destroy all creatures except for Mageta the Lion. Those creatures can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: In the jungle of war there is always a Lion.
cards.originalText: {2}{W}{W}, {T}, Discard two cards from your hand: Destroy all creatures except for Mageta the Lion. Those creatures can't be regenerated.
